oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Motion for further relief in Mapp v. Board of Education of Chattanooga, 1968 December 30
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Williams, Avon N.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Motion for further relief written by attorney for James Mapp, requests that the United States District Court require the Chattanooga Board of Education to submit a plan which would have the "affirmative effect" of ended segregation in Chattanooga public schools.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mapp v. Board of Education of Chattanooga; Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
United States. District Court (Tennessee : Eastern District)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Mapp v. Board of Education briefs, memoranda, and legal documents, 1968-1969
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
